newsitem.title: USA: U.S. exporters sell 100,000 T wheat to Sri Lanka.
newsitem.headline: U.S. exporters sell 100,000 T wheat to Sri Lanka.

text.p: U.S. exporters reported sales of 100,000 tonnes of optional origin wheat to Sri Lanka for the 1996/97 marketing year, USDA said Wednesday.
The wheat was 50,000 tonnes hard red winter and 50,000 tonnes soft red winter.
Under an optional origin contract, the origin of the commodity may be the United States or one or more other exporting countries, USDA said.
The marketing year for wheat began June 1.
Exporters are required to report sales activity of 100,000 tonnes or more of one commodity to a single destination daily, and smaller amounts weekly.
